lexUnit.name: echo.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: (of a sound) reverberate or be repeated after the original sound has stopped

sentence.text: Eerie sounds echoed around the passageways .
His shouts echoed around the cylinder formed by the walls .
Their whispering and low moans echoed around the empty flat , like ghosts that danced on the ceiling with their shadows .
Flipping lazily on to her back , she floated with her eyes closed for a moment , frowning as the sound of a door closing echoed around the pool .
A low whispering sound echoed around the room .
The deep silence was disturbed only by an occasional flurry of wind echoing strangely around unseen rock faces -- the giant sighs of a sleeping mountain .
From where he lay on his side inside the laundry basket , he could hear the noise of the showers echoing around the stone walls of the House .
He took careful aim with his second barrel at a smaller buffalo that had begun circling in dismay , and they heard the dull thud of his successful shot echo clearly across the plain .
The rattle of the sword he had held aloft echoed across the cobblestones .
Loud music echoed across the site , so loud that it could be heard 10 miles away .
` I 'm quite sure Dora can do without the services of an emissary , " she said coolly and his laughter echoed across the empty garden .
Their voices echoed back and forth across the water like the calls of water birds .
The sound echoed hollowly throughout the tall empty house .
A loud bang echoed through the valley .
The shrill blast of their brazen trumpets echoed triumphantly through the heart of the land .
His shout echoed through the house .
Her voice echoed flatly from distant walls .
She heard her name called from below , the sound distorted as it echoed from the depths .
The restful clunk of the grandfather clock echoed round the room .
A dry laugh echoed down the wire from Buchanan Street .
A loud explosion echoed up the hillside .
` Ready for yer tilt now ! " he called out , his voice echoing round the vast wooden space .
So , in spite of the semi-dark , the uneven terrain , the twisting path , he rowelled his horse on as fast as he could , its hooves beating out a staccato that echoed hollowly .
